They are better tolerated and are less toxic in overdose

The reason he was close to danger was because an extremely poisonous beetle was crawling down his shoulder.

Ingested gliadin and PT-gliadin are toxic to coeliac patients .

definition: An Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.
example:
Pilot Mountain in NC is very prominent.

First, from the Saturday images, the most prominent feature is a

sharp spike emerging from the tailward side of the nucleus.

I was left with a deep and conspicuous scar (about 10cm long) which felt uncomfortably tight and itchy.

definition: An Agent is described as pursuing an Activity, expending some effort. The Agent may be active in a particular Role. Alternatively, the Activity itself may be described as having an Agent who is expending effort. In some cases, the Activity may involve a Salient entity which may stand in for it.
example:
Sky, a Korean War veteran, was active in his opposition to Vietnam and continues to protest current combat in Iraq.

She is active in the community by establishing parent groups, life skills program, sharing circles and various Aboriginal cultural activities for young women. .

John Colville was quite active as a land speculator in both Virginia and Maryland .

definition: A Political region, often a nation, has an economic system, theEconomy, defined by the level of production and consumption of goods and services. The Market type or Domain may be specified.
example:
The Canadian economy will continue to expand in 2005.

Medical industry is a new force in the industrial economy of Lin'an .

definition: A certain Idiosyncrasy belongs to an Entity distinguishing it from other entities.
example:
If you have 32 totally idiosyncratic meanings for a term in a class, everyone will be very confused when they talk!

The art of change-ringing is peculiar to the English

definition: An implicit cognizer judges that a particular State of affairs for which a Protagonist is responsible is socially unacceptable.
example:
He called it a disgraceful situation .

To my mind it was undoubtedly the most utterly shameful act the chess world had witnessed since 1485 .

It is not at all shameful for a man to allow himself to be ruled by others .

We are grateful to Mr. Mattick for bringing this disgraceful building and its vile nuisance to the attention of the Henley District .

That comparison is shameful because it is comparing apples and oranges .

definition: In this frame, an Entity or Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question. The general implication is that the Entity or Behavior provides evidence for some (as yet unproven) socially undesirable conclusion about a (usually implicit) Social actor. (Such conclusions often include the idea that some individual is lying, or that a crime was committed.)
example:
We found some suspicious checks lying on his desk.

It was rather suspicious of you to leave the party just before the police arrived .

definition: The Quantity of a Collection occurring in a Place has a particular Measure, which is related to the amount generally needed.
example:
There is evidence that volatile materials have always been scarce on the Moon .

A global effort to tackle water scarcity is getting underway.

It is the scarceness of these precious metals that adds to their luster.

definition: As is usual for locative relations, the location of the Figure is specified as being inside a region defined relative to the Ground. In this case, the region measures outward from the Ground with a width specified by the Distance.
example:
The number of large galaxies within 5 million light years is three.

What 's within 100 miles of you ?

Two of Russia's long-range bombers flew around Iceland last Friday -- coming within striking distance of the United States for the first time in five or six years .

definition: This frame describes a particular compounding construction (a pattern of coinage) by which more complex words can be created by joining an Honored entity to a Dedicated type to describe a particular Dedicated entity which has been officially named for the Honored entity. The Dedicated type and Honored entity FEs each form part of the Lexical Units (annotated on the second FE layer), and the Dedicated entity is the denotation of the whole. Since each of the FEs is a part of the Lexical Unit, there is no assignment of Grammatical Function or Phrase Type. The Dedicated type should (in principle) also be annotated as a LU in a separate frame. Targets are added opportunistically to this frame in the course of annotating other frames. For example, the Day of Armistice Day should also be annotated in the Calendric unit frame.
example: 1st layer: Turn right at the Jefferson Building .

definition: A particular State of affairs is desirable. The State of affairs may be required to achieve a Purpose. A set of Circumstances may be specified under which the assessment of desirability holds.
example:
You should take the doses about 12 hours apart and at the same time each day .

If the metal is seriously rusted or warped , it should be repaired or replaced with a chimney top damper .

To ensure that , you should have no CLASSPATH set .

definition: Words in this frame describe a relationship in which an Item is expressed through a Text.
example:
The act of murder is rampant in the Bible .

In his State of the Union Address , President Bush committed our nation to achieving three great goals of our time .

Linnaeus in his writings often quotes his great predecessor .

definition: In this frame an Undergoer is in a phase brought about after a change of phase. This can be its inherent phase or indicate that it is returned to its inherent state.
example:
Collect up the thawed water from the freezer section.

Put under the broiler until the cheese becomes melted.

Major companies are switching to liquefied natural gas .

definition: An Entity shares a name with its Namesake. Note that the shared name is not a frame element as it cannot be directly expressed as an argument of the target lexical units in this frame.
example:
Alberta's namesake caught in royal scandal

namesake caught in royal scandal

Instead, the eponymous character is a mildly retarded woman, Martha (Winger), whose simplistic view on life places her in ethically compromising positions.

He is my namesake, one amongst the many described in my homepage, and is much better qualified to write a page like this.

definition: An Entity that has characteristics which change over time is at a point or in a phase of its development in which, compared to other actual or expected stages of development, it possesses extremely high or low powers or intensity. The high or low level of development correlates with the occurrence of a Marker, a product produced by the Entity or an event in which it participates, which is indicative of the Entity's abilities or intensity.
example:
The Tang Dynasty was the high point of the Silk Road's importance .

Meeting Fiona Bennett was the LOW POINT of my summer .

It must be remembered that this man was born at the zenith of the Victorian age and witnessed the glory of Britain at her greatest.

But Lubitsch was at the high point of his genius , and he has made a masterpiece not to be missed.

definition: A Protagonist performs some Action without fully considering the circumstances under which he or she acts, or the possibly (negative) consequences of the Action. Alternatively, the Action itself may be portrayed as having been performed under rushed circumstances.
example:
Would it be a little impatient of me to ask when an album might appear ?

He was quick to move, alert and forceful, as he was impetuous in attacking an enemy

definition: An Evaluee, which can be a person or an object, has an amount of acceptability or utilization based on general (often non-aesthetic) desirability. The Judge who determines the Evaluee's desirability may be mentioned.
example:
Frank Sinatra is cool again.

Web 2.0 is so in right now .

definition: A Subset is profiled against the Group it belongs to. The Subset may consist of a single member. Frequently, the Group is actually a generic sample of a full population, and the Subset is representative of the relative proportion.
example:
Of all scenes that evoke rural England , this is one of the loveliest.

As of 5:30 p.m. Moscow time, 23 out of 46 miners stranded in the Zapadnaya-Kapitalnaya mine have been rescued

1.5 out of 10 respondents preferred Shrub over Ferry

definition: This transparent noun frame is concerned with Units for measuring the Area of regions.
example:
Hillary lives in the middle of 10 acres of wheat .

Paul owns 20 hectares of land .

definition: Against the background of a contextually salient non-real world, for instance a hypothetical, imagined, simulated, expected, projected, or dream world, an Instance of a Type encountered in a relation or event in the real world is presented as being different from the instance found in the non-real world. Of course, the real-world Instance of the expected Type may also be presented as not occurring, as in the last example below.
example:
Actual results may vary.

Also present is the actual policeman , now 20 years older and helping to cast and prepare the young actor who'll be portraying him onscreen.

Of course, an actual car with all these capabilities simply did not exist.

definition: An Experiencer senses different degrees of warmth that may or may not be related to the ambient temperature. The level of warmth is usually compared against the Experiencer's subjective standard of comfort.
example:
My feet are cold.

The fire will keep you warm.

I 'm too hot with this sweater on.

definition: A Cognizer possesses knowledge about the workings, significance, or meaning of an idea or object, which we call Phenomenon, and is able to make predictions about the behavior or occurrence of the Phenomenon. The Phenomenon may be incorporated into the wider knowledge structure via categorization, which can be indicated by the mention of a Category. The Cognizer may possess knowledge only in part and this may be expressed in a Completeness expression. The Cognizer may also be realized as a cognitive-emotional Faculty that is conceived of as having understanding. Note that the knowledge may have been acquired either from instruction or from the Cognizer's own experimentation, observation, or mental operations.
example:
Our sensations are in some sense to be understood in terms of a set of stimulation levels (spiking frequencies) in the appropriate sensory pathways .

The mind is often unable to comprehend the significance of what it perceives .

I realized I had not properly understood my own needs

Nobody seems to have explained this to her, but finally she understands

The draughtsman must fully comprehend what he is drawing

My father failed to comprehend that his explanations were based as much upon faith as mine

I figured this out last week and now I really understand it .

definition: A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient entity formed on the basis of past experience. The Cognizer may also remember the Salient entity in a particular State, which serves as a frame of reference in the Cognizer's mind. When attention is focused on a Salient entity, then mention of a global Experience is excluded and typically, but not always, either a State or Impression of the Salient entity is presented.Episodic memory is the explicit memory of events. It includes time, place, and associated emotions (which affect the quality of the memorization). Episodic memory contrasts and interacts with semantic memory, the memory of facts and concepts. This definition is concerned with this latter type of memory.
example:
The part I vividly remember was about a South Seas tramp steamer captain .

He remembered him as a kindly man but not a very lively one.

Retro games are great, but a lot of the time people get clouded by nostalgia and remember them to be better than they really were

When he died he was just a kid himself but for some reason at the age of 44 I still remember him as older than me .

Somehow I remember him as older, with long eyelashes, and doe eyes .

Hummel says staff, both students and professional, remember her as a very good friend, available for new staff and well-respected by everyone.

I wanted to remember how good that felt .

Who remembers me being a total dork and going up to everyone saying Hey, I'm Ashley Hunt from Chicago !?!

That's probably before my time, which was long time ago, Fish may remember that time .

Kozmo could remember when his modem was the fastest he could buy .

definition: Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other. The similarity may be based on appearance, physical properties, or other characteristics of the two entities. However, no such Dimension has to be specified explicitly. The Entities may be like each other to a greater or lesser Degree. Rather than specifying the Dimension of difference, a Differentiating fact may be mentioned.
example:
Lothlorien is quite like most of their other war games really.

Great Britain and Germany were only alike in one respect .

Recovering it afterwards can also be similar to collecting an unsecured loan

A mulberry is very similar in shape to a loganberry

definition: An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the Cognizer's engaging in an Action as a consequence of the influence; or the Cognizer may be influenced in how they carry out a Behavior that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a Product may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the Cognizer's experience of the Situation or Entity.
example:
I'm sure if I asked Mattel what inspired this car I would be told it's an original design, and not supposed to represent any actual car.

These works had a profound effect and influenced her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region .

definition: A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender. This definition also has a Recipient distinct from the Goal, as both can be present.
example:
I sent Bill the manuscript.

I forwarded the grain to a dealer in Frankfurt .

I sent the manuscript to England to Bill .

definition: A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause of shine.
example:
The walls glowed in the sun .

The quartz glowed with a fitful, internal light .

Something was shimmering on the shore .

The oily mud gleamed wetly under his feet .

Still glowing from the forge ...

The grass glistened with dew .

definition: A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category. In this process, the Cognizer may either passively perceive the Item and note that it fits the Criteria for a Category, or, alternatively, actively examine the Item for certain Criteria that define a Category (or set of Categorys).
example: You 've already stereotyped me as a bimbo , have n't you?

definition: Medical conditions or diseases that a patient suffers from, is being treated for, may be cured of, or die of. The condition or disease may be described in a variety of ways, including the part or area of the body (Body Part) affected by the condition (e.g. liver cancer, cardiovascular disease), the Cause of the condition (e.g. bacterial meningitis, viral pneumonia), a prominent Symptom of the condition (e.g. asymptomatic stenosis, blue ear disease), the Patient or population (originally) affected by the condition (e.g. bovine tuberculosis, juvenile diabetes), or the (proper) Name used to identify the condition (e.g. Munchausen Syndrome, Lou Gehrig's Disease).
example: John died of pancreatic cancer.

definition: Perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
example:
I smell something rotten.

Smell this to see if it's fresh .

She gazed upon him fondly .

definition: The definition covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically detached from something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be disconnected from each other. In the first, an Agent detaches an Item from a Source, creating an asymmetric relationship between the Item and the Source. In the second, the Agent attaches two Items to each other, where each serves as a Source relative to the other, creating a symmetric relationship between the two Items. Note in both cases, after the removal of the connector, the Items that were formerly attached re-appear as the two separate or potentially separate entities that they were throughout.
example:
She unhooked the leash from Patty's collar , and pulled her up on the couch.

Before adding a new area of color , he detached the canvas from the stretcher and laboriously scraped away the old paint in that spot.

They finally unchained me from my desk at work and I'm leavin town.

definition: One phenomenon, Phenomenon 1 is an indication of the current or future existence of another phenomenon, Phenomenon 2. There is no Cognizer present on the scene. Many words in this definition also allow a slightly different understanding, whereby Phenomenon 1 provides clues as to the good or bad Outcome of an expected Phenomenon 2. Instead of Phenomenon 2 an Interested party that will be involved in the event or state that is Phenomenon 2 may be mentioned. In both construals, the two phenomena are asymmetrical and consequently they have no joint syntactic realization.
example:
I wish I could say my success bodes well for him .

Cold-blooded words do not necessarily betoken a callous nature .

ill omen.

Such potential

augurs

definition: An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant. Typically, this involves placing a reagent in contact with the Material, or applying heat, pressure, etc. Often a specific Agent and/or Result is mentioned. The Alterant is often incorporated in the target.
example:
Watering cans are often galvanized to prevent rust .

Native Americans dyed textiles with dyes made from cedar strips .

definition: An Experiencer desires that an Event occur. (Note that commonly a resultant state of the Event will stand in for the Event.) In some cases, the Experiencer is an active participant in the Event, and in such cases theEvent itself is often not mentioned, but rather some Focal participant which is subordinately involved in the Event.
example:
Susan really wishes that you 'd listen to her .

The company waseager for him to leave as soon as possible .

I only wanted one piece of candy .

definition: These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
example:
I 'm late for my departure !

My flight is early by 20 minutes .

The following morning , she tried to figure out what it meant .

After she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk .

definition: An Agent, Actor, Entity, or Medium causes a Phenomenon to be perceived by a Perceiver. With an Actor, Entity, or Medium, the Perceiver is usually unspecified.
example:
The economy is showing signs of growth .

The second scene depicts Dad holding the ball for a place kick .

He exhibited great interest in the project .

Aileen showed Rob the book .

definition: A group of Colonists from a Homeland migrate to and proceed to settle in a New area. The New area then becomes their permanent home. The New area and Homeland are in some way construed as being part of the same organization or system. In the case of (people from) nation-states colonizing other areas, the colony and nation-state are considered a single political entity. In the extended sense of living things in general colonizing or settling a new area, the original Homeland must still inhabited by some of the same group. In this sense Colonization is distinct from migration or exodus. This definition also includes metaphorical uses involving animals or plants, or abstract domains such as ideas.
example:
As the years progressed and adaptations occurred new species and subspecies began to populate the islands .

Conservatives don't get what the left gets, which is that the left has already colonized and converted whole university departments .

Deciduous trees such as red alder subsequently colonized the logged area .

If a colony from Britain was established in that large tract of Country, and if we were at war with Holland or Spain, we might very powerfully annoy either state from our new settlement.

Finns colonized the land from the south some 2,000 to 4,000 years ago

In the 7th century BC, Phoenicians colonized the eastern section of Libya.

In the 7th century BC , Phoenicians colonized the eastern section of Libya .

definition: Nouns that denote Units of measurement for volumes.
example:
many cups of coffee

a cup of coffee

two cups of coffee

Sue drank two liters

Greg drank two 2 liter bottles of lemonade .

definition: Either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or saliently fails to bring about a particular experience. Some words indicate that the Stimulus is characterized by the experience it is likely to evoke in an Experiencer and for these, the Experiencer may rarely be present. There may also be a Degree to which the Stimulus affects the Experiencer and Circumstances under which the experience occurs. There may also be a Comparison set to which the Stimulus is compared and a Parameter that indicates the area in which the Stimulus has its effect.
example:
The report was very alarming to me .

That was certainly a gratifying experience .

That movie was quite fascinating.

The view is breathtaking in January .

definition: A Cognizer makes a judgment about an Evaluee. The judgment may be positive (e.g. respect) or negative (e.g. condemn). There may be a specific Reason for the Cognizer's judgment, or there may be a capacity or Role in which the Evaluee is judged.
example:
She accused Einstein of collusion.

She admired Einstein for his character.

definition: A Theme is moved by a Vehicle which is not directly under their power. The Source, Path, Goal, or Area of the motion may be indicated. The Distance traveled or the Speed of motion may also be indicated. A Route or Roadmay be present and the Manner in which the Theme moves may be given.
example:
Mr. Bigglesworth rides route 51 .

Every day, Martin rode the bus on highway 880 .

Sally flew 3000 miles from San Francisco to New York .

Mrs. Smith rode on the train .

definition: An Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it. For living entities, this may entail a proliferation of instances of the entity, or of desirable properties associated with the (single) entity. For non-living entities (economies, political locales, academic topics, etc.), this entails a proliferation of instances, or of activities that lead to instances, or any attribute that would prevent the entity from disappearing. This state is conceived of as temporary, or at least contingent on a number of changeable factors. Words expressing the opposite state, i.e., a lack of such positive activity, are also in this definition.
example:
Construction companies thrive on public projects .

In the 1920s the peach industry flourished in Upson County .

definition: The Connector is an artifact created to affix a Connected item or to bind onto a Fixed location and is primarily so used. A more specific Use may also be specified. Certain words (e.g. bond, chain in the phrase in chains) indicate specifically that the Connector is being used to immobilize something. Connectors have a wide variety of physical forms: long, thin, and flexible for tying (ropes, bonds, withies); solid, with a shape corresponding to holes in the entities to be connected (bolts, nails, pegs); and liquid (glues, adhesives, pastes).
example:
I think they cut his bike chain with bolt cutters.

She jerked on His neck rope again, to keep his attention.

His bonds had to be loosened before they could be cut.

A waterproof adhesive should be used for this exterior job.

definition: A Speaker talks about a Topic, which may be an action performed by the Speaker or an entity or state of affairs that they are associated with in order to suggest that the Speaker is worthy of admiration. The Speaker may give an explicit Reason why the Topic redounds to their credit. Alternatively, a Message can be used to directly describe what the Speaker says, leaving the more specific Reason for admirability to be inferred. Instead of the Speaker, the action may be attributed metonymically to the Medium, or possibly the Expressor.
example:
70's comics like Chevy Chase and Steve Martin over-stated their egotism and preened over their superiority .

The press release boasts that a direct connection between the cartridge and the system means no more having to blow dust out of game cartridges .

He then vaunted his own clan , but failed to mention Emanuel Ungaro, who described the omission as ''lamentable''.

Turkish officials boasted of giving 'tens of thousands of dollars in surreptitious payments' to a prominent American politician .

definition: One linguistic unit, Sign 1, has a relation to another linguistic unit, Sign 2. This relation may be semantic, phonological, orthographic, or distributional in nature. The parameter along which the two signs are set in relation to each other is incorporated in the meaning of the target words. When the relation is symmetrical, the two linguistic units can be expressed jointly, Signs. Otherwise they have to be expressed disjointly. Ordinarily it is assumed that one linguistic unit has exactly one meaning but in cases where this is not so, a set of Circumstances may be specified that helps pick out the relevant sense.
example:
In one sense , dog is a hyponym of itself .

Happy and sad are antonyms.

definition: A group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration. The Individuals or the Configuration may be expressed as the external argument of the predicates. It is ambiguous whether or not the Individuals intentionally come together. In an alternative construal, a grammatically more prominent Party 1 congregates with a Party 2, expressed as an oblique phrase. If this asymmetric construal is chosen, Purpose relates only to Party 1.The congregating happens in a certain Place and at a certain Time.
example:
The architects amassed in the lobby .

The crowd came together in the courtyard .

definition: An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled situation. Generally, when the Enabled situation is left unexpressed the Enabled situation is interpreted to be the desirability of the Item being located within a particular range on the Scale. With many of the adjectives of this definition, the Scale is not explicitly mentioned; in such cases, the Scale is usually the quantity, incorporated in the meaning of the targets themselves, though in the case of adequacy, etc. the Scale referred to is quality.
example:
The particles are sufficiently small in diameter that they may be considered points .

I was way too hot .

I was too mad to keep myself from screaming .

I was mad enough to scream .

I probably have enough.

definition: A Cognizer creating a new intellectual entity, the Idea. These words are similar to words of physical creation such as build and make, and in some cases may be understood as metaphorically based on such words. However, the Ideas are predominantly conceptual in nature.
example: I 've been trying to come up with a plan .

definition: An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration. Emphasizes the effect on the Earner and often generalizes across an indefinite number of transactions with various parties. Some of the LUs (e.g. earn.v) primarily refer to the to the Earnings without reference to cost, others to the amount the Earnings differ from the cost, emphasizing either a net loss (e.g. loss.n) or net gain (e.g. net.n).
example:
After a $ 1.5 million loss , the company is in no state to continue .

We made nearly two million on resales alone last year .

This reflects the 15 % jump in earnings over 1994 .

definition: A Cause causes an Effect. Alternatively, an Actor, a participant of a (implicit) Cause, may stand in for the Cause.
example:
The ending left me feeling kinda empty .

You 've made it impossible to continue !

The strange mutations of the rumor mill in the end led to it being said that he was actually a woman .

If such a small earthquake causes problems , just imagine a big one!

He made me angry .

definition: The static comparison of an Profiled item to a Standard item, often with respect to some Attribute. There is an inherent asymmetry between Profiled item and Standard item in that the two cannot be expressed jointly as a subject. Degree expressions are also found that indicate how close the items are to each other on the scale evoked by the Attribute. Furthermore, the particular value of the standard or item on a certain scale may be given by the Standard attribute of the Profiled attribute respectively.
example:
The current price matches the price last year .

Few pianists have ever equaled the lightness and vivacity of his rhythm .

Peyton Manning's passing yards are equaled among NFL quarterbacks by only a select few .

Mexico's Copper Canyon rivals the Grand Canyon in sheer beauty and drama .

The Sun is putting on a show that rivals the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers .

definition: An Experiencer does not achieve a Desired goal. Typically, the Experiencer is the object of the verb. Metaphorically, a pursued entity is not captured.
example:
A simple truth has evaded so many of us .

His point escaped the entire audience .

Success eludes me .

definition: A Traveler goes on a journey, an activity, generally planned in advance, in which the Traveler moves from a Source location to a Goal along a Path or within an Area. The journey can be accompanied by Co participants and Baggage. The Duration or Distance of the journey, both generally long, may also be described as may be the Mode of transportation. Words with this definition emphasize the whole process of getting from one place to another, rather than profiling merely the beginning or the end of the journey.
example:
The Osbournes took a trip from Beverly Hills to London on the Concorde .

Samantha journeyed 2500 miles with her family by sea to China .

Ellen journeyed to Europe with five suitcases .

definition: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs. Means and Instrument may also be indicated.The goal of the punishment/reward is to discourage/encourage the actions or beliefs. Words with this definition presuppose that a judgment of the Evaluee has occurred and that the Evaluee is (or becomes) aware of the judgment. This judgment was performed by a cognizer which is either the same as the Agent, or, minimally, a representative of the same institution.
example:
I believe that this behaviour should be subject to disciplinary action .

The penalty for this crime is death .

Her punishment was too harsh.

His punishment of the prisoners was too harsh.

definition: A Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor. Crucially, these lexical units do not entail that the Protagonist was unable to complete the Action or that the Action did not occur. The Hindrance may indicate a lack of enablement or an obstacle on the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action
example:
The new dam impeded the flow of water .

Many candidates' progress is severely impeded because they have to resit for the exam .

A lack of money hampered our plans .

Malcolm was hindered by his drinking problem .

definition: The infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An Avenger performs a Punishment on a Offender as a consequence of an earlier action by the Offender, the Injury. The Avenger inflicting thePunishment need not be the same as the Injured Party who suffered the Injury, but the Avenger does have to share the judgment that the Offender's action was wrong. The judgment that the Offender had inflicted an Injury is made without regard to the law.
example:
(3) The next day, the Roman forces took revenge on their enemies. .

(2) Lachlan went out to avenge them .

(1) They took revenge for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners .

definition: Words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body. A number of words with this definition occur as blends with Communication, in which the action has an Addressee.
example:
The boy swung his legs from under the table .

She nodded to him to sit down.

Pat nodded at Kim .

definition: This scenario describes a series of Events, associated a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant. The Events do not necessarily form a coherent whole (e.g., are not necessarily causally related), but merely occupy a period of time. In many cases the history is limited to what are considered the important or significant events. Words with this definition can also denote the time period over which the sequence of Events took place.
example:
Our areas of strength are British, American and European History from 1492 to 2000 .

The following sections document the entire 25-year history of the company .

We've been worried about our recent hire's history of deceiving employers .

definition: Parts of objects that are defined relative to the center or edge of the object. The Part is a part of the Whole and the Part Prop describes a property of the Part... In cases where the Target is an adjective, it has a special relationship with the noun that it modifies such that a phrase which is a syntactic argument of the noun is semantically available to fill the argument structure of the adjective, as in the outside row of the class
example:
The inner shelf of the bookcase was lying on the floor.

She preferred a sparse church interior .

She discarded the exterior of the walnut

definition: Nouns denoting types of entities. The Subtype refers to a collection of members of a more general Category which have certain defining characteristics; alternatively, the Subtype refers only to the type itself, i.e. a more restrictive set of characteristics than those of the more general Category. The properties of the items that are included in the collection may be specified by the Item Property. Sometimes the Subtypes themselves are described by some Type Property.
example:
I think that she was referring to the other type .

He argued against the formalist type of analysis of art .

Kleo isn't our sort of people .

I don't like this newfangled kind of fish .

definition: A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee. The judgment may be positive (e.g. praise) or negative (e.g. criticize), and this is indicated by the semantic types Positive and Negative attached to the lexical units. Does not contain words where Evaluee and the Addressee are necessarily the same . It involves the communication of an evaluation, rather than merely forming and holding a particular evaluation.
example:
Gaston denounced him to the committee .

I commended his handling of the crisis .

definition: Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes. The parties are also construable separately as Exchanger 1 and Exchanger 2, in which case the Themes may be construed separately, too, as Theme 1 and Theme 2.
example:
We exchanged addresses and he told us that next year when we are in Aruba we will visit with his family there.

Then the teams swapped their draftees .

They swapped the island with the Neapolitan government of the day for the much smaller Capri .

definition: Words that express an Object's position on a scale, its Measurement, with respect to some attribute, its Dimension. Location, identifying the sub-region of the Object where the Dimension is measured, may also be expressed. Adjectives must appear with a measurement expression like 5 cm.Note the tagging of six feet on the GF and PT layers in the following sentence.The GF of six feet is Dep and the PT is NP.
example:
The woman was six feet tall.

The new vase is 5 cm in circumference at the top .

The tower is 10 feet tall.

definition: Generally without overall (translational) motion, an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled. The Theme is under the control of the Agent/Cause at the time of its arrival at the Goal. It focuses on the Theme rather than the effect on the Goal entity. It differs from Removing in focusing on the Goal rather than the Source of motion for the Theme.
example: David placed his briefcase on the floor .

definition: A Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics. The Cognizer may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the Phenomenon, that belongs to the Ground or is contained in the Ground (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present). Some words allow alternate expressions of the Groundand the Phenomenon:
example: We searched the yard for my contact lens .

definition: An Experiencer is in a State where a biological urge is signaling the need to perform a certain action such as eating, drinking, stopping exertion, sleeping, regurgitating, or having sex.The Duration, Time, Place, or Degree of intensity associated with the occurrence of the urge may also be indicated. The Experiencer does not necessarily want to perform the action that would fulfill the urge, and there is no specific focus associated with the urge.
example:
Sam wasthirsty after dinner .

Mike feelshungry.

definition: A Goal has a Source from which it has gotten a Theme.The Goal may be a sentient recipient who has actively obtained the Theme but it may also be a non-sentient entity that gets the Theme as a result of natural or other processes that it does not control. Covers metaphorical uses those cases where a person has obtained information from another person or a textual source, which they typically intend to disseminate further.
example:
Crews was held in contempt and ordered to jail after refusing to reveal his source for the claim that Big Basket Weaving is circumventing import tariffs on reed.

This is not true according to our source .

The state remains the dominant source of research funding .

Pakistan informed IAEA and US officials investigating the network that North Korea was the source of the uranium shipment .

she is my friend...not to mention my source for French madeleines !

definition: A particular Situation is likely (or unlikely) to result in a harmful event befalling an Asset. The Situation may be a state, an activity, or some focal entity that must be inferred to be part of some larger Situation involving both it and the Asset.
example:
The primary risk is to our infrastructure .

Customers can make complaints about unsafe products .

Is climate change dangerous for mankind ?

definition: An Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content. A Reason for the emotion may also be expressed. Although the Content may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion. With certain verbs, the Circumstances can be expressed in a finite clausal or wh- complement which may optionally be preceded by a Null NP Object: Note: This is not how it is currently tagged.
example:
I hate it when you do that .

Smoking gives me extreme pleasure.

Sergio derives great pleasure from smoking .

Smithers takes great pleasure in collecting matchboxes .

My enjoyment of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.

definition: An Agent or Cause changes the consistency of an Undergoer from its Initial state to a Result. This may take place under certain Circumstances for a Purpose or Reason in a certain Manner. A Change agent can also be used. Describes causation of a change in an Undergoer within a particular phase.
example:
The high temperatures curdled the milk .

Donna thinned the soup with chicken broth .

definition: These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated Source because it is the source of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way. Some words with this definition, such as empty, may also occur with Path or Goal expressions, e.g.
example: The players emptied the bucket over his head .

definition: A Question about the reason or cause of a known State of affairs is presented as being answered by the existence of a particular Fact. The exact chain of reasoning, including the answer itself, of which the Fact is a part is not specified.
example:
Somehow this explains why Apple is always the last man to get the technology .

That explains it .

Lack of potential for improvement in the immediate future accounts for the low number of returnees into South Ossetia, even for the Ossetian ethnic group .

Then that I exist is explained by A and B having come together .

The nation's history explains why the current conflict succumbs to, and yet simultaneously transcends, the stereotype .

Ruby's orange vest marked with the words service dog accounts for why the 3-year-old goes along .

definition: An Deformer deforms an Undergoer possibly against a Resistant surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Result, a new shape. Some of these words indicate that the Result is an undesirable alteration of the norm, and in such cases the lexical unit is marked with the semantic type Negative. Does not include senses that specifically indicate causing harm to a living being.
example:
A killer hurricane nearly flattened Sylvester Stallone's five luxury homes in Hawaii .

Mix butter and sardines very thoroughly , mashing them with a fork until you have a smooth paste .

Michael flattened the can against his head .

Ellen crumpled the paper into a ball .

definition: An Accused individual is deemed by a (usually implicit) Judge to be involved (or not) in a Misdeed. Is not limited to technical, legal uses. The use of guilty in this definition is not referring to an emotional state. Innocent can mean 'ignorant of'; 'innocuous'; 'pure and unsullied by experience'.
example:
It is possible that the Frauleins Krabbe , Breuer and Moller are guilty of serious wrongdoing .

I aminnocent of this crime and so is James Griffiths .

definition: A Cause or Agent causes an Undergoer to undergo a change of phase. The Result of the change may be given, along with the Initial state and the Circumstances under which the change can occur. Describes causation of a change of an Undergoer between different phases (i.e. solid to liquid or frozen to unfrozen).
example:
Sally defrosted the chicken to eat for dinner .

Bob melted the butter .

definition: An Operator manipulates the substructure of a System such that the System performs the function it was created for.Does not profile the purpose of an agent but rather their manipulation of an entity (System/Instrument). In the case of using, the Agent need not manipulate the Instrument at all, as in: Mrs. Adams used the room as a place to hang the family laundry to dry.
example:
A California man has plead guilty to federal charges that he ran a pyramid scam which defrauded nearly 7000 investors.

This true story of domestic bliss was related to me by a friend of mine who for a time operated a bar in San Francisco .

definition: What Clothing the Wearer (or a specific Body part of the Wearer) has on.Many targets incorporate the Clothing item, and some targets describe the state of not wearing something (when it might be expected). NB: There is a very common metonymy in which characteristics of the clothing stand for the clothing itself, such as Such sentences should be tagged METAPHOR on the sentence level.
example:
She was dressed all in red .

the man clad in leather .

Do you think anyone would notice if I went topless?

These two losers were wearing bras on their heads !

I hadon the most ridiculous monkey-suit you could imagine .

definition: A Preventing cause or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place. The Preventing cause does not directly prevent the actions of an individual, but rather affects the world in such a way that an Event cannot occur. Some lexical units, like avert and avoid indicate that the Preventing cause would have been affected if the Event occurred.
example:
The government narrowly averted a coup .

He could have stopped the riot .

Rain prevented the ball game from taking place .

definition: Motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver. Some words normally allow the Vehicle to be expressed as a separate constituent. Other words in this domain are based on the names of vehicles, and do not normally allow the Vehicle to be expressed as a separate constituent. However, a separate Vehicle constituent can occur if it adds information not included in the verb.
example:
Tim biked across the country on an old 10-speed .

The group biked all the way across the country.

Tom paddled my canoe across the Canadian border .

Tim drove his car all the way across North America .

definition: These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity (the Governed) or an Activity. The definition refers to both nouns referring to a title or position (e.g. director, king, president), and verbs describing the action of leadership (e.g. rule, reign). With verbs, it is possible to mention the Role played by the Leader (often a name of a leading position, e.g., king)
example:
Louis XIV ruled over his people as king for the longest period of any European monarch .

In 1789 Fletcher Christian led the mutiny on HMS Bounty

Sebek em hat was a Leader of Priests . ca. 1780 BC

definition: Words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their proximity of residence. This relationship may be defined either symmetrically (as Residents) or asymmetrically (in terms of a Known resident and a Indicated resident). The Residents or the Indicated resident may have an Age, Descriptor, Persistent characteristic, or Ethnicity specified.
example:
I have a Swedish roommate that translated for me!

The dead included homeowner Todd Underfoot, 33, his wife Spring Back Underfoot, 32, their housemate, Luisa Life , 46, and two of the Underfoot's three children.

definition: A Profiled item is higher that its Standard item on a scale with respect to some Attribute. The Extent of the difference between the Standard item and the Profiled item may also be mentioned. Furthermore, the particular value of the standard or profiled item on a certain scale may be given by the Standard attribute of the Profiled attribute respectively.
example:
The current price surpasses the price this time last year .

We surpassed father's skills before we were 12 .

Radio WKRR far surpasses all radio stations among rural radio stations as the leading source of regional news .

Notices for the Shield Theater's production of Macbeth surpassed all previous reviews .

definition: An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole patient no longer existing as such. Several lexical items are marked with the semantic type Negative, which indicates that the fragmentation is necessarily judged as injurious to the original Whole patient.
example:
Tear into 6 inch strips, each about one inch wide , then bake at 400.

She shattered the vase with a casual backhand blow to make it look like there had been a struggle .

Don't go in there or you 'll be torn to bits !

He rippedup the letter faster than you can say Jack Robbins .

definition: An Agent or Entity becomes sufficient enough to meet a Standard. Alternatively, an action or occurrence can be thought of as Event that fulfills a Standard. The Agent, Entity, or Event can be conceptualized as being on a scale where a change of value or circumstances brings it in line with the position of the Standard on the scale.
example:
Will Ben fulfill his obligation to Margaret ?

This paper does not meet the requirements for graduation .

definition: Has similarities to Experiencer subject, but here the verbs are more 'active' in meaning. (For example, they often occur in negative imperatives, e.g. Don't worry!). They also differ from Experiencer subject verbs in that they occur with Topic expressions and can be used in the present progressive: *Pat is fearing the exam.
example: Pat is still worrying about the exam .

definition: An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state. Often this non-canonical state is undesirable, and some lexical units (marked with the Negative semantic type) specifically indicate that the Patient is negatively affected.
example:
Please don't damage the goods .

Some ne'er-do-wells defaced the Park's wall with spray paint to show their anger at local natural resources allocation policy .

That idiot just dented my car !

definition: A Preventing cause interferes with the ability of a Protagonist to complete an intended Action. The Protagonist may not be mentioned in the sentence, in which case the Action is an endeavor that an individual or group of individuals hopes to accomplish. It is necessary that the Protagonist is unable to successfully complete the Action.
example:
He was foiled in his attempt to overthrow the government .

He prevented her from running away .

Noriega's troops foiled a coup attempt .

definition: Clothing and its characteristics, including anything that people conventionally wear. The Wearer wears a Garment that has a certain Style, is made of a certain Material, and can be otherwise characterized by a Descriptor. In some cases, the Body location (where the garment is worn) and Subregion of the clothing may also be specified.
example: Claudia dressed in a dark green cotton DRESS clasped round her slender waist with a broad yellow belt , drank a cup of coffee and opened her neglected post .

definition: There is a Part of a Whole in which the Part is defined with respect to the canonical or inherent orientation of the Whole. In cases where the Target is an adjective, it has a special relationship with the noun that it modifies such that a phrase which is a syntactic argument of the noun is semantically available to fill the argument structure of the adjective, as in
example:
He rested on the cliff top

My left hand was numb.

The bottom was missing.

The top shelf of the bookcase was lying on the floor.

the front row of the class

definition: Transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals. As opposed to aggregate words such as group, set, these Quantity do not have a status as Wholes on their own.
example: He found them in the deluge of papers on his desk.

definition: There is a certain physical Distance within which some other entity can participate in an Event (typically perception or manipulation) with the Participant. Alternatively, the Event may be indicated metonymically by a Instrument . [Note the connection with *Distance, Sufficiency, and Capability. Words with this definition can generally be paraphrased close enough to be able to.]
example:
Jordanian troops came within easy strike of Israel.

I would consider striking distance to be about two meters for this weapon.

But then they passed out of my earshot . INC

They are now within missile range .

They are now within our missile 's range .

They are now within our missile range .

I'm sorry, but he was well within the blast range .

definition: A Player finishes a Game, possibly with an outcome of winning or losing. A Game is an activity that is considered recreational, and is valued for associated pleasure, as well as social interaction, material reward, or status. Not all games can be won or lost.
example:
John lost.

John won the lottery !

definition: A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee. In some cases, the Addressee is expected to keep the Information from other parties. The Information may be damaging to the reputation of the Speaker.
example: Could it be true that Martin himself was the one who spilled the beans on Pops and Brad's planned wedding ?

definition: An Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out). In some cases, the Agent is a focal participant in the Plan, although a separate Focal participant may also be mentioned. The Plan may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect.
example:
Channing House has recently implemented a new dining program for residents on pureed diets .

Health authorities say they have put measures into effect in all ports of entry and in centers of provinces .

definition: Entities that occur in some temporally-ordered sequence.  The entities thus have some sort of relation between them.
example: Describe in detail the sequence of steps taken during an emergency .

definition: The appointment of a New leader or removal from office of an Old leader. The Selector brings about the change in leadership, for example, by electing or overthrowing a leader. Some words with this definition describe the successful removal from office of a leader (e.g. depose, oust), others simply the attempt (e.g. uprising, rebellion).
example: On March 17 , Mamedov appointed Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .

definition: The fictive motion of a stationary Road.Some of the targets cast the scene primarily in terms of the Path shape: Some of the words with this definition imply a Source or Goal which is expressed by a direct object: Other members refer to a Direction:Yet others indicate a Path which requires mention of a landmark:
example:
The otherwise arrow-straight highway veers north and skirts the lake .

Then the path bears a little to the right .

The path entered the garden on the west side .

The long mountain road meandered through the woods .

definition: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated Goal because it is the goal of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way.
example: Lionel Hutz coated the wall with paint .

definition: The process of making amends for some (wrongful) action (the Injury) committed by the Wrongdoer. In this process, in order to appease the Injured party or to follow laws or customs, the Wrongdoer performs some Benefiting action for the Injured party or gives the Injured party some Gift.
example:
The tribesmen tried to make amends to us with handfuls of their most precious seashells .

Sinn Fein said that the marchers had to make restitution to the Catholics for the disruption and violence .

I will make it up to you .

definition: A Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a Figure within a Ground. It is often unknown to the Perceiver whether or not the Figure exists within the Ground. Alternatively, the Expressor may be expressed as showing signs of the Perceiver's state of attentiveness.
example:
They demand an attentive gaze , a careful accounting of parts.

Legislator tells consumers to be alert to dioxin levels .

definition: An Entity has a particular scalar Attribute with a value exceeding a contextually-specified or generally-understood standard.
example:
After his back injury, he won't lift heavy boxes .

That ladder is really tall.

definition: An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent. The danger that the Agent puts themselves in by performing the Action is profiled. The danger is not spelled out, but generally the Action has a possibility or likelihood of causing social or physical harm to the Agent.
example: I risked taking another look .

definition: General words for Individuals, i.e. humans. The Person is conceived of as independent of other specific individuals with whom they have relationships and independent of their participation in any particular activity. They may have an Age, Descriptor, Origin, Persistent characteristic, or Ethnicity.
example:
I always thought of him as a stupid man.

She comforted the terrified child.

I am dating an African-American man.

I study 16-year-old female adolescents.

She gave birth to a screaming babyyesterday.

A man from Phoenix was shot yesterday.

definition: A commutative operation of arithmetic, e.g. addition and multiplication, involving two numbers, labeled Term1 and Term2 or, collectively, Terms. When referencing the process, the numbers can be vague and are often omitted through indefinite null instantiation. There may also be a Calculator who applies the operation.
example:
Any kid knows addition.

Add three to five .

definition: Non-verbal communication. Topic is not normally expressed with these words. This seems to be related to the absence of a verbal code in cases of gestural communication. Topic can be viewed as a partial characterization of a Message, but such partial characterization is either difficult or irrelevant in the absence of a verbal code.
example: I gestured with my hand for him to come over .

definition: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action. This may be an action desirable (as with promise) or not desirable (as with threaten) to the Addressee. Some of the words with this definition allow an Addressee to be expressed.Other words cannot normally occur with an Addressee.
example:
Kim undertook to finish the project by June .

You promised me you'd come to my graduation .

definition: An Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic. There can also be a Circumstances under which the response occurs or a Reason that the Stimulus evokes the particular response in the Experiencer.
example:
She flashed a jubilant smile .

Franz gets infuriated at the thought of his ex-wife remarried .

The furious parent stormed into the office.

Mr. Whiskers is upset that there are no more cat treats .

definition: How a Resource controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose . They can be applied to the Resource controller or to their Behavior in particular instances. These words indicate a judgment of how conservatively the Resource controller guards their Resource.
example:
To spend the surplus now would be needlessly profligate .

Bill squanders his money .

Margeret has always been penny-wise.

definition: A Group is described as having members which are similar or dissimilar to each other. The Degree of similarity may also be expressed. Some of the nouns are transparent (e.g. range.n) whereas others denote the scale of diversity (diversity); variety.n is usable both ways but is normally transparent.
example:
A range of answers were proposed .

The diversity of students here is to be applauded .

definition: A State of affairs is prohibited by a Principle. The Principle which prohibits the State of affairs is not an agent who denies permission to a specific individual or group of individuals.
example:
Code 1425 bans large trucks in the tunnel .

Guns were prohibited in the airport .

definition: A State of affairs is permitted by a Principle. The Principle which sanctions the State of affairs is not an agent who grants permission to a specific individual or group of individuals .
example:
No religion accepts discrimination against women

Code 1425 allows us to deduct interest payments .

Children were not permitted in the office .

definition: A Cognizer applies oneself to commit a Pattern to memory, so that the Cognizer would recognize future examples of the Pattern or be able to reproduce it. The Cognizer is construed as acting alone, with no indication of an interacting individual that provides guidance.
example:
It is possible to memorize by rote and at the same time have a full grasp of the underlying meaning.

A gaggle of students were frantically memorizing the answers out in the hall .

definition: The interrelation of a collection of Entities; they may be physical entities or shapes in a recognizable configuration, a pattern of events, or a relation among abstract entities. The pattern is not the individual Entities nor the set of Entities, but an abstraction of their interrelations, as a gestalt.
example:
The digits of irrational numbers do not repeat in any kind of pattern

The auditors noticed a suspicious pattern of withdrawals from the maintenance account .

The Cougers are playing in a Wing-T formation tonight.

definition: A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought entity. The Sought entity is not presupposed to exist. The search activity is not concerned with the state of the Ground, but only with the finding of the Sought entity, which is desirable.
example:
Mulder rummaged through his toilet kit for a plastic razor .

Scientists scoured the ice samples for signs of life .

The newcomers combed the area looking for minerals

definition: Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a Responsible party. If the Duty is not performed, there may be some undesirable Consequence for the Responsible party, which may or may not be stated overtly.
example:
Should insurance be compulsory?

When I was in HS, marching band was mandatory in order to participate in any of the other ensembles

Fressed too much at the obligatory BBQ .

It would behoove us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples

definition: A Perceiver who fails to keep sight of a Theme. The focus is the Perceiver, which appears in subject position.
example: The police lost the burglar as the thief turned the corner .

definition: The manipulation of an Entity by anAgent.
example: Ian squeezed Mara's hand .

definition: An Experiencer's feelings of tolerating with respect to some Content. A Reason for the toleration may also be expressed. Although the Content may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.
example: He could not tolerate the smell of coconut .

definition: A Theme who evades the sight of a Perceiver. The focus is the Theme, which appears in subject position.
example: The burglar lost the police as the thief turned the corner .

definition: An Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event. The Event will then take place for a New duration, rather than the Initial duration. This can be done with by certain Means, in a certain Manner or to a certain Degree.
example:
Harsh weather made it necessary to cut the tour short from its original four months to three .

Don't let him prolong the discussion to an absurd length .

definition: An Agent manipulates a Fastener to open or close a Containing object (e.g. coat, jar). Sometimes an Enclosed region or a Container portal may be expressed. Since the Manipulator is syntactically omissible, many verbs incorporate the Fastener.
example:
Mary buttoned her coat .

Mary closed her coat with one hand .

Mary closed her coat with a belt .

definition: An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech, that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind. The Text may include information about its topic.
example:
Jot any notes you need below the line in red pen only .

The brothers said not two words to each other .

I penned a letter concerning racism to Congress .

definition: General words for Individuals, i.e. humans, whose specific acts or general behavior is evaluated against standards of morality or rightness. The Person may have an Age, Descriptor, Origin, Persistent characteristic, or Ethnicity.
example:
There are endless disputes about this sort of thing, both in and out of the courts, because wrongdoers will say and do anything to avoid getting punished.

Columbus: Was he a Hero or a Villain?

definition: The Support, a phenomenon or fact, lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain of Relevance may also be expressed. Can be used for communication words used in a non-communicative, epistemic sense.
example: The latest poll results show that support of the president is at an all-time low.

definition: An Agent supports their body in a particular Location. Conveys which body part is the Point of contact where the Agent is supported, what orientation the body is in, and some overall arrangement of the limbs (especially the legs) and the torso.
example: He knelt down Location , hand on heart .

definition: An Experiencer experiences an Emotion or is in an Emotional state. There can also be an Evaluation of the internal experiential state. Inalienably possessed aspects of the Experiencer frequently stand in for the Experiencer.
example:
Her heart felt angry .

Dr. Hibbert feels good .

Martha feels angry .

John feels anger towards his mother .

definition: A Situation or Protagonist creates conditions that push the Cognizer towards executing an Action, or which influence the Cognizer in an Activity. The words with this definition imply that the Cognizer actually does something.
example:
Discuss the things that guided you in making your decision .

Despite this huge variety, there were only two main factors that significantly influenced the artist's work.

Despite this huge variety, there were only two main factors that significantly influenced the artist's work .

Her interest in history has largely influenced her in her work .

The murder of my brother influenced me to study Law .

definition: An Undergoer changes its consistency. There may be a Initial state and a Result. Describes a change in an Undergoer within a particular phase (solid, gas, liquid).
example:
The liquid gelled into a semi-solid mass .

The blood congealed.

definition: A lump of Dough expanding as gas develops inside it. This is part of a process where, in order to produce a lighter, more easily chewed bread, Dough is leavened with yeast, baking soda or in another fashion to add gas to it before baking.
example: I've got no frozen boxed meals, and no other real options to make something to keep me going while my pizza dough rises.

definition: A Resource controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit) according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource. The Resource controller may exhibit this attitude with an Expressor.
example:
Sally has always been generous to her children .

John is mean with money .

definition: The likelihood of a Hypothetical event occurring. The Hypothetical event is its only core element. Notice that in the case where a noun phrase is the subject of the Support Verb, that NP is also tagged as Hypothetical event.
example:
He islikely to arrive late .

It is likely that he'll arrive late .

definition: Nouns denoting a part or parts of a Whole entity . The Part is not defined relative to the Whole's orientation, center, or edge and is not ordered. We also annotate properties of the Part, e.g. relating to its size.
example:
Abby ate only the top half of the cake .

Kim forgot a large part of the story .

definition: A situation in which an Owner loses his or her Possession. The Owner may have failed to keep ownership of their Possession (i.e. robbery or gambling) or may have unintentionally misplaced their Possession.
example:
He lost his wedding ring while playing cards .

I misplaced my watch .

definition: General words denoting equipment where the Use or purpose is not specified by the lexeme but (typically) by a separate expression. The words are described with respect to the Use for which the item is used or its typical User.
example:
The dentist's equipment is expensive.

We got a new coffee machine.

definition: A Cognizer believing that some Phenomenon will take place in the future. Some words (e.g. foresee.v) indicate that the Phenomenon is asserted also to be true, while others do not.
example:
From the look on her face Michael expected that she would say she got the job .

Michael expected Abby to demand examples .

definition: Electricity, in particular as a form of energy harnessed for particular uses (such as powering machines). The Source of the Electricity may also be expressed, or incorporated in the meaning of the LUs.
example:
China's hydroelectric dam is being built primarily for flood control and energy production.

A compound to generate wind electricity was built on the other side of those mountains.

definition: In a text, a Source of information is given that provides a reader of the text with further Information relevant to the text. The author and reader are completely deprofiled, with the Source of information made salient.
example:
Use my() for local variables whenever you can get away with it (but see perlform for where you can't ).

The 'foaming regions' play the role of 'internal shocks' (cf. Piran's recent publication for a review ) of GRB theory.

definition: A Body mark is present on a Possessor's body. It may be located at an Attachment and have a Descriptor. A Cause may also be indicated. It may be a temporary condition or a permanent one.

definition: A specific subset of Instances of a Type which are evaluated in terms of their similarity to a conceptual prototype of the Type. The judgment of exemplariness may be made along a certain Domain.
example:

definition: The Hearer receives a Message or communication on a particular Topic. Words with this definition denote events of verbal communication, but express the Hearer rather than the Speaker as an External Argument.
example:

definition: Words which describe the dimensional extent and Shape of a Substance. These words do not make reference to a Part-whole relationship. There can also be a descriptor of the Shape, Shape prop.

definition: An Agent or an Entity that does or does not meet a Standard. Alternatively, an action or occurrence may be construed as an Event that meets or fails to meet the Standard.

definition: Contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities. We will ignore uses of words like baptize and christen that don't clearly bring out the name conferral but talk about the meaning of baptism etc. as a sacrament:

definition: A Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.

definition: The Undergoer, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process caused by another entity, which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. The process may or may not be under the control of an Agent.

definition: Transparent nouns denoting a Piece of a Substance. Also present is Piece prop which is a property of the Piece, e.g. relating to its size..

definition: A Container is in a state of fullness/emptiness with respect to some Contents.

definition: Assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.

definition: Noise verbs used to characterize motion. Motion noise verbs take largely the same Source, Path and Goal expressions as other types of Motion verbs.

definition: People's knowledge or skill in certain domains.  It does not concern acquaintance or familiarity with people.

definition: A Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces. The Theme is not necessarily a self-mover.
example:

The paper fell to the floor .

definition: The repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.

definition: A Cognizer being aware (or not being aware) of the difference between two Phenomena, which may be expressed jointly or disjointly.
example: It is very difficult for people to visually distinguish between living and non-living things from such a great distance .

definition: A Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
example:

definition: Nouns that denote Units of measurement for linear extent.
example:

The shirt is made from 12 miles of pure cotton .

definition: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.
example: Samantha terrorized the children into screaming .

definition: The temperature of an Item changes. An Initial temperature, Final temperature, or Temperature change can also be indicated.

example:

definition: An Undergoer, which is an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decaying from an Initial state to a Result.
example:

definition: A Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs or expectations.It only includes uses where a Cognizer is expressed.

definition: An Informer informs the Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper Behavior of the Wrongdoer.

definition: Non-artifact Images resulting from an interation between light and some kind of matter, usually a Source entity.
example: I could see John's silhouette in the corner as I entered the dimly lit room.

definition: The creation of a Flame by a Kindler or the igniting of Flammables by a Kindler.
example:

definition: An Agent preserves an Undergoer in order to prevent it from decaying. A Medium may be used.
example:

definition: A Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
example:

definition: People (the Residents) residing in Locations, sometimes with a Co-resident.
example:

definition: A Fugitive presents himself or herself to the Authorities to be subject to the criminal process.
example:

definition: Permanent fixed structures forming an enclosure and providing protection from the elements.
example:

The city tour includes the 16th-century monastery of the Transfiguration and Church of Elijah the Prophet

definition: Manners of verbal communication. All of them can occur with quoted expressions.
example: He slurred his confession .

definition: An Authority orders a Protagonist not to engage in an Action.
example: The police officer forbid me from turning around .

example: He ranks second in his class in mathematics .

definition: A Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.

definition: A Container holds within its physical boundaries the Contents.
example: The box holds three hundred pictures .

definition: Words that name subparts of buildings that can be occupied by people.

example:

definition: A period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
example: The best time of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.

definition: Words referring to items of food.

definition: Words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial value) to an end point (Final value). The direction (Path) of the movement can be indicated as well as the magnitude of the change (Difference). The rate of change of the value (Speed) is optionally indicated. Accidents increased 20% to 345 .

definition: A Protagonist needs a Means action performed for their Benefit. The relevant Means action is often evoked only by reference to an Intermediary who performs it. definition: A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed. Can apply to any method of communication (speech, writing, gesture, etc.).

An Asset which is in danger of loss may stand in for the Bad outcome. There is no implication that the Protagonist intentionally exposes themselves to the risky situation. The Protagonist may be attempting to achieve some Purpose, which involves being in a dangerous situation. The Severity of risk involved may also be expressed.
example:

definition: An Agent wants to achieve a Goal, or an object, a Means , has been created or is used to allow the creator or a user to achieve a Goal. The Goal is a state of the world that does not currently obtain but which the Agent wants to realize and is planning and/or working towards. In some cases, it is difficult to decide whether a noun phrase metonymically stands for the Agent or the Means (e.g. The goal [of this paper/seminar/project] is to determine ...). We mark these phrases as Agent on the first layer but also annotate them as Means on a second annotation layer.In some cases a Restrictor on the Goal state of affairs can be given prominence as a separate constituent. Talk about Goals frequently includes the mention of a Domain to which the Agent's Goal is relevant.
example:

definition: A Communicator processes some information (either from textual or real-world/perceptual sources) regarding a State of affairs into a concise form (a summary) that contains the essential content in briefer form, and communicates this summary to an Addressee, or records it in a Medium. The State of affairs may be represented directly (e.g., outline what happened, the situation abroad), or as a textual source (summarizing the documents), or metonymically as some focal entity (a synopsis of the candidates).Some LUs, such as summarize and synopsis entail a preexisting body of information that has been processed into a briefer form by the Communicator. Others, such as outline and blueprint are compatible with, but do not entail, a preexisting, fully fleshed-out concept. E.g.,

definition: The absolute Value of a quantifiable Attribute of an item is determined by adding up the values for the Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item. The item is not expressed as a separate constituent but it is presupposed by the concept of Attribute. Alternatively, the Numbers form an implicit set whose sum is the Value associated with the set. In some cases what is reported is just the cardinality of the individuals that make up the item so that in effect the Value is a count. In other cases the identity of the Attribute can only be inferred from the Value.

definition: The movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier. The Agent, a person or other sentient entity, controls the shared Path by moving the Theme during the motion. In other words, the Agent has overall motion in directing the motion of the Theme. The Carrier may be a separate entity, or it may be the Agent's body. The Constant location may be a subregion of the Agent's body or (a subregion of) a vehicle that the Agent uses. This definition emphasizes the path of movement.
example:
